copayment is absolutely a thing here. it’s usually called “excess” for private hospital admission, and “gap” for outpatient consults (be they medicare or private).

coinsurance is too kinda. private insurance will often say they cover (100-coinsurance)% for a given category.

2. Coinsurance - %  you pay for a covered service, generally after the deductible has been met. Ex: a lab test costs $1k. Your deductible is $600 & coinsurance is 20%. You pay $600 (deductible) + $400 * 0.2 = $680
